I need to think through how to maximize my score in this round.

My immediate thoughts are centered on scaling the Green Joker and Spare Trousers. I have four discards available. The Mystic Summit Joker is tempting, but a zero-discard hand is unlikely. I really want to be able to scale the Green Joker to max. I need to note that each discard costs me a mult on the Green Joker (+1 per hand played, -1 per discard), and that Spare Trousers gains +2 multiplier if I play a Two Pair. And, importantly, I have three hands to play.

First, I need to consider all the ways I can win. This hand can be a simple Three of a Kind with the Jacks. The base Three of a Kind gives 70 chips and 7 multiplier. With the Green Joker (+10 mult), Spare Trousers (+2 mult) and the independent multipliers, I can easily exceed the target of 3000 chips – I'm looking at upwards of 5400 chips here, which will be the base.

However, scaling is always more fun! With this in mind, and remembering that I have a single Justice card consumable, I want to use it optimally. I'll need to use it on either the Ace or King.

Next, I need to look at if I can even make a Two Pair. I can't.

If I discard to find a Two Pair, then I lose out on the Green Joker scaling. However, if I discard to find a Two Pair, I can scale the Spare Trousers. However, I think that just playing is better.

I have come to my final thoughts: I need to win, and to do that the best thing is to just play the Jacks. The current setup is more than enough to win, and also to move on. There isn't a benefit to drawing cards or using my Justice card on anything.

I need to confirm the order of the Jokers. Green (Holo, scaling), Mystic Summit (0 discards only), Spare Trousers (Two Pair), Certificate, Luchador (x1.5), Constellation (x1.9). That's a solid order. Additive then multiplicative. Perfect.

The final play: I will just use the Three of a Kind.

# Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
select <pack_card_position> <hand_card_position1> <hand_card_position2> ... <hand_card_positionN> - Select a card from the booster pack. The hand card positions may be required depending on if the booster pack card selected needs targets. In 'Mega' booster packs that say 'choose 2 of N', make the selections one at a time. If you intend to select cards 1 and 3 for example, issue a 'select 1' command, then a 'select 2' command, because the 3rd card position will become the second position after selecting the first card.
skip_booster - Skip the remaining selections in the current booster pack.
rearrange_hand <card1> <card2> ... <cardN> - Rearrange the hand of cards. Every index in the list of current cards must be present, i.e. if there are 5 cards, the indices 1-5 must be present.

**Balatro Arcana Pack Analysis**

Okay, here's the situation: Ante 3/8, Tarot pack step, $37. Boss blind is "No repeat hand types" with 4000 chips. I have a decent set of Jokers: Green Joker (+11 Mult, Holo +10 Mult), Mystic Summit (+15 Mult if 0 discards), Spare Trousers (+2 Mult, scales on Two Pair), Certificate (adds sealed cards), Luchador (x1.5 Polychrome, sell to disable boss), and Constellation (x1.9 Mult, scales on Planet use). I've got a Justice Tarot card in hand, ready to use.

My main goals are to scale Constellation and find a way to counter the upcoming boss. Emperor looks like the best option here, for a chance at planet cards, which will feed Constellation. Temperance is tempting for the cash, but I don't really need it right now. Judgement is too risky, I'd have to sell a Joker I don't really want to part with.

Right, so Emperor it is. But wait, I need to consider my consumables. I have Justice which I can use, but Emperor generates 2 cards. I currently only have one slot. I'm fairly certain I can use the Emperor cards in the pack, but to maximize the Emperor's value, I really need to use the Justice *first* to make space. The Emperor description says "Must have room", so I don't want to risk losing a card.

I can't take *two* actions on one turn, so I need to make the Justice decision now. I can use Justice on the Jack of Hearts, or any card in my hand for that matter to make it Glass which is a straight up multiplier. Justice on the Jack of Hearts it is. This doesn't advance to the next game state, I'm still in the pack.

Okay, let's execute that. I'm going to `use_consumable 1 3` to get the Justice boost on the Jack. Then, next turn, I can select Emperor and hope for some good Tarot card generation. I'm now certain that I'll get 2 cards if I have room for them. After some more review of the situation, I am certain about using Justice first to maximize the chance of getting two additional Tarot cards. After careful consideration, I'm going to follow the plan. I will be sure to apply Justice to the Jack of Hearts. Then I will select the Emperor Tarot.

Final decision. Let's go.
